entry.def: You use single to emphasize that you are referring to one thing, and no more than one thing.

example.ex: Over six hundred people were wounded in a single day...
example.tran: 仅一天中就有 600 多人受伤。

entry.def: You use single to indicate that you are considering something on its own and separately from other things like it.

example.ex: Every single house in town had been damaged...
example.tran: 镇上每栋房子都遭到了破坏。

example.ex: The Middle East is the world's single most important source of oil.
example.tran: 中东是世界上最为重要的一个产油地。

entry.def: Someone who is single is not married. You can also use single to describe someone who does not have a girlfriend or boyfriend.

example.ex: Is it difficult being a single mother?...
I now have to face the rest of my life as a single person...
example.tran: 我现在不得不孤单一人度过余生。

entry.def: A single room is a room intended for one person to stay or live in.

example.ex: A single room at the Astir Hotel costs £56 a night.
example.tran: 阿斯蒂尔酒店的单人间价格是 56 英镑一晚。

entry.def: A single bed is wide enough for one person to sleep in.
A single ticket is a ticket for a journey from one place to another but not back again.

example.ex: The price of a single ticket is thirty-nine pounds.
example.tran: 单程票的价格是 39 英镑。

entry.tran: (只录几首短歌的)单曲唱片;(激光唱片上的)主打歌曲，单曲
entry.def: A single or a CD single is a CD which has a few short songs on it. You can also refer to the main song on a CD as a single .

example.tran: 现在的孩子都不买单曲唱片了。

example.ex: The winners will get a chance to release their own single.
example.tran: 获胜者将有机会发行自己的单曲唱片。

entry.def: Singles is a game of tennis or badminton in which one player plays another. The plural singles can be used to refer to one or more of these matches.

example.ex: Boris Becker of Germany won the men's singles...
example.tran: 德国的鲍里斯·贝克尔赢得男单冠军。

example.ex: She is equally at home on the singles or doubles court.
example.tran: 她单打和双打都能得心应手。

entry.tran: (板球中的)一分打;(棒球中的)一垒打
entry.def: In cricket, a single is a hit from which one run is scored. In baseball, a single is a hit by which a batter reaches first base.

means.word_mean: 1. badminton played with one person on each side
2. tennis played with one person on each side
